titleStmt.title: Description of University of Pennsylvania Oversize Ms. Codex 1049: Thomas Nevell's day book

availability.licence: These images and the content of Rare Book & Manuscript Library Oversize Ms. Codex 1049: Thomas Nevell's day book are free of known copyright restrictions and in the public domain. See the Creative Commons Public Domain Mark page for usage details, http://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/mark/1.0/.

notesStmt.note: Forms part of the Wetherill Papers.

msContents.summary: Financial records of Thomas Nevil, also known as Thomas Nevell, including expenses and payments received, mostly between 1762 and 1776. The end of the book contains recipes for the medical preparations of a Dr. Weed, signed over to Samuel Wetherill by Rebecca B. (Reed) Nicholson, written between 1795 and 1801.

supportDesc.foliation: Paper, 222 leaves; ii, 1-200, [201-203], 204, 204, 205, 205, 206, 206, [207]; f. 107-196 blank; f. 197-222 contain records and recipes, with some pages of recipes marked with inconsistent contemporary foliation.

layoutDesc.layout: All pages (including blank ones) ruled vertically by hand in red ink for columns for figures.

binding.p: Contemporary leather with blind stamping and label on front pastedown reading "Sold by David Hall at the New Printing-Office, in Market-street, Philadelphia"; in extremely poor and fragile condition. Covers are detached; all text pages at beginning and end have been disbound and encapsulated; blank pages are still in a sewn block.

origin.p: Entries written in Philadelphia between 1762 and 1801.

history.provenance: Gift, as part of the Wetherill Papers, of Proctor and Reeves Wetherill to the Industrial Research Department, University of Pennsylvania, 1937.
Transferred, as part of the Wetherill Papers, to the Rare Book & Manuscript Library, University of Pennsylvania, 1963.
